benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods - Add a payment method

covered: POST Method: Valid Payload scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11) demonstrate successful creation, optional behaviors, and edge cases.
POST Method: Invalid Payload scenarios (TC12 malformed JSON, TC13 missing required fields) validate input handling.
POST Method: Validation and data integrity (TC19, TC20) test invalid input patterns and security considerations.
POST Method: Server Error Handling (TC18 - service unavailable, TC27 - downstream/integrity issues) cover http 5xx / error reporting.
Authorization & Headers: Tests for missing/invalid authorization and missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy header (TC16, TC17) cover access control and required headers.
Edge case / integration tests: Non-existent account (TC15), existing payment methods scenarios (TC06, TC07), downstream sync (TC26) and plugin interactions (TC04, TC08, TC26, TC27).
Performance and reliability: Basic performance (TC28, TC29) and concurrency (TC23) scenarios addressing timing and race conditions.
gaps: Rate Limiting: No tests specifically validating how the API handles burst or rapid consecutive requests.
Caching Behavior: No tests asserting caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or related caching semantics.
Pagination: Not applicable to POST add-item use-case, but guideline mentions pagination for large datasets; not relevant here but note for completeness.
Security-focused input sanitization tests beyond general invalid inputs (e.g., more exhaustive SQLi/XSS edge cases) could be expanded (TC19/TC20 cover some, but broader coverage could be added).
Regression/Backward-compatibility coverage: While TC25 and others touch backward compatibility, broader checks across API version changes could be expanded.
Error messaging localization/accessibility: Tests touch error presence but not accessibility or multi-language/error message readability beyond status codes.
recommendations: Add a dedicated rate-limiting test to ensure the API enforces throttling under high request volume.
Add tests to verify caching headers are present and correct (ETag/Cache-Control) for POST responses where applicable.
Expand security edge-case testing with additional SQL injection and XSS vectors beyond those in TC19/TC20.
Include explicit tests for idempotency in duplicate submissions to ensure no unintended side effects on repeated requests.
Consider explicit backward-compatibility checks across multiple known client payload shapes from older API versions (beyond TC25) to strengthen regression coverage.
Add accessibility-focused checks for error messages and documentation exposure (TC30 touchpoint) to include screen reader compatibility and descriptive ARIA-like considerations if applicable.
